channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Binbags of rubbish from public space need collecting, 7th September
item.description:
Rubbish was strewn all over Bostall Heath from several ripped bin bags dumped by the car park on Longleigh Lane. This has now been gathered by up a volunteer resident (me) and is awaiting collection.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Young tree has broken free of support, 7th September
item.description:
Relatively young tree outside 66 kings avenue has broken free of its support and is leaning over. Needs resupporting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Avenue, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant waste, 7th September
item.description:
There is a constant stream of waste onto the street from the property. The garden is filled with waste, front and back, which is then periodically dumped onto the street. This has been going on for months. The problem will only stop at source.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ledrington Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Fairhazel gardens and Broadhurst gardens, 7th September
item.description:

item.title: Inside Chalcott square, 7th September
item.description:
This has been broken for months and it’s a miracle no kid or parent hasn’t hurt themselves. It needs fixing. The residents round here pay enough in council tax to have this resolved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chalcot Square, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 7th September
item.description:
Latest round of Flytipping on Faversham Road - both outside the Mind shop and on the other side of the road next to the lockers outside the Premier convenience store. Litter up and down the street once again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Faversham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 19-21 Cantwell Road Communal Garden, 7th September
item.description:
Can the borders and hedges in the communal garden be cut back please. This hasn’t been done for a few years and the self seeded trees are getting quite large now and need to be cut back. There are also fence panels missing/ broken and the back wall which collapsed a few years ago. The remains of the brick wall are under the brambles at the back. The back wall also needs to be replaced. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cantwell Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed and mattress fly tip 19& 21Cantwell Road, 7th September
item.description:
A bed and mattress have been left by the resident’s moving out of 21D. Please can they be collected. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cantwell Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Flytip again !!!!, 7th September

item.title: Fly tipping- security of vehicular access, 7th September
item.description:
This fly tipping episode raises the issue of how a vehicle has managed to access the meadows (possibly from the car park end or directly via Rectory lane). Tracks can be seen clearly on the attached photograph.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, London

item.title: Park needs refurb and upgrade, 7th September
item.description:
Zip line is broken and dangerous for children. The swing and tarmac has been broken for months maybe a year. A lot of the equipment is faulty and tarmac is falling apart. The whole park needs upgrading at the moment it is dangerous for children to play in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martens Avenue, Barnehurst, London
